revised_title: Estimating the Monocot-Dicot Age through Chloroplast tRNA Sequences
tldr: The authors used chloroplast tRNA sequences to estimate the age of the monocot-dicot split in plant evolution, finding it to be between 230 and 360 million years ago. This date is consistent with previous molecular estimates and suggests that the whole group of angiosperms is older than the monocot-dicot divergence.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Molecular Biology
